intro: Mancoa henricksonii, commonly known as the Henry's mancoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
